alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Huerfano and northeastern Costilla Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 452 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cuchara, or 8 miles southwest of Indian Creek just off the edge of the Spring Burn Scar. This storm was drifting slowly northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall rates of up to 2 inches per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause localized flooding of roads, creeks, streams and drainages. If the storm remains strong as it enters the Spring Burn Scar, Flash Flooding will be possible. Locations impacted include... Open country centered 10 miles southeast of Fort Garland, and Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
